item.title: I'm adding gambling
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

They can win, an estimated 50% of the item rewards have a value of 55k or higher, therefore only even if the win is only a mere 5k they gain profit.
Anyhow thanks for sorting my code out for me. I’ll post my Item.randomLowGame() from item.java? In a few minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm adding gambling
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

if (objectID == ####) {
	if (playerHasItem(995, 50000)) { //50k GP needed or you can't stake
		addItem(Item.randomLowGamble(), 1); //Adds a random item from the Low_Gamble array
		deleteItem(995, 50000); //Removes 50k from your inventory
		sM("You bet 50,000 coins and gain a low level item.");
	} else {
		sM("You do not have 50,000 coins to gamble with.");
	}
}

I fixed your formatting and conventions. You had an extra closing bracket and were missing a “)”. Now your code looks fine, though I don’t know how your methods work. I can guess that sM() just sends the client message packet to the client. You may want to post the code for Item.randomLowGamble(), so that I can check if your randomizing looks fair. Also by the looks of your code, you can’t win? Since they gain a low level item each time?

Read full topic

item.title: I'm adding gambling
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

So I’m trying to add ‘Gambling’ to my server by clicking chests and losing money to gain a random item. I need some assistance, I’m not sure if this would work, my code may be a bit messy or capitalised wrong because I have typed the code by hand. I need some verification on this please. Or some help if I’m wrong, thanks!

if(objectID == ####) { if(playerHasItem(995, 50000) { //50k GP needed or you can't gamble addItem(Item.randomLowGamble(), 1); //Adds a random item from the LowGamble array deleteItem(995, 50000); //Removes 50k from your inventory sM("You bet 50,000 coins and gain a low level item"); } else { sM("You do not have 50,000 coins to gamble with"); } } }

Read full topic
